job.title: Embedded Software Engineer
job.description: <p>Do you want to design software for electric vehicles?&nbsp;If so, and you enjoy working with a great, small team of engineers, we may have the job for you!</p><p>&nbsp;</p><p>We are looking for a Embedded Software Engineer to code and debug real-time embedded firmware for electric motor controllers/inverters.&nbsp;</p><p> <strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>What you’ll do:</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><ul><li>Write effective and efficient real-time software.</li><li>Follow software development cycles, including software requirements capture and verification of software to these requirements.</li><li>Design, setup and run tests to ensure the design meets specifications.</li><li>Debug systems.</li><li>Provide support to continuation engineering and other Curtis engineering teams.</li><li>Participate in the preparation of development specifications.</li><li>Work within a small design team to complete assigned objectives.</li><li>Collaborate with Curtis engineering sites around the world.</li></ul><p><br></p><p>&nbsp;<strong>We are interested in hearing from you if you possess the following:</strong></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree plus 3-5 years of experience in embedded, real-time software.</li><li>Skilled in real-time software programming using high level languages.</li><li>User of emulators, in-circuit testing and software debugging tools/techniques.</li></ul><p>&nbsp;</p><p><strong>Nice to have:</strong></p><ul><li>Experience with serial communication protocols using CAN, for example CANopen, J1939, UDS, etc.</li><li>Knowledge of control and feedback systems for power and motor control.</li><li>Knowledge of real-time operating systems and task schedulers.</li><li>Knowledge of electronic circuits and implementation.</li><li>Experience with Model-based design (MBD).</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills.</li><li>Effective verbal and written communication skills.</li></ul><p></p>
